Hey guys, here is the update. I suggest to have this design for the left panel:

  1. Selected narrower has not a white background but a bit lighter grey. This allows to move from tinted blue hover color to have 2
  2. White background for the hover. Provides maximum contrast.
  3. No rectangles around counters allows to increase number size, increase horizontal space for the text. Right now counters grab too much of attention on a desktop. But if you don't trust my vision here and want to increase attention, we can do is to make them a bit darker/bolder.
  4. We still need to experiment with hiding counter number on hover, but if we don't like it I suggest to shift a number on hover to the left to free up space for the context button.

image.png

I like most of the details here! (Sorry, catching up on some of the threads I skipped while this stream was very active last month).

I think the main thing I'm worried about is removing the boxes around the unread counts; it feels harder to immediately visually parse which topics have unreads, probably because while the text is larger, the elements themselves are a lot smaller / more subtle.

Oh, I also don't like having the unread count effectively disappear on hover; we tried that when working towards the current design, and it makes it confusing when the only visual distinction between threads with unreads and not is invisible.

A couple other details we might want to try to put into a left sidebar design here:

  • Some some special marker/visual indication for streams/topics with at least one mention of you. We don't have that feature today, but it should be not hard to add engineering-wise, since we have the data already sent to clients in the same data structure that powers the rest of the left sidebar.
  • We should have a resolved topic in our screenshot, since I assume we'll continue using the gutter to display them.
